intro: Physopsis chrysotricha, commonly known as the golden-haired physopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, yellowish stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed beyond its native habitat.
